column4: why was i able to run it by double clicking in 64 bit Ubuntu, but can not in 32bit?
what is the format of the package
.sh package
you'll need to run that from a shell
no idea, but it's a "shell" script
terminal yeild "Panic Initial setup failed. Cannot Continue"
so there is a problem running that script on your machine, you need to debug it
ok.. walk me thru that.
I can't it's quite complex, you need to work out what part of the script is failing and why -
run run "file $scriptname" replacing "$scriptname" with the name of the script
tell me what it comes back with eg: "file install.sh"
HoNClient-2.1.8.1.sh: POSIX shell script text executable
any other thoughts
sorry, I was just away for a minute
not a prob
so that confirms it is a shell script, so you need to walk through that shell script and find out what's causing it to fail
im not sure i understand why i was able to install Hon and the updated Display drivers within 11.04 x64 yet 11.04 x86 is giving me fits.
there is something about your current system that the shell script doesn't like/expects different, you need to talk the shell script though and work out what's failing
wow.. that sounds like a bit of work
exactly, hence why I said it's quite long winded to walk you through it
is it possible that something from my install cd or during install didnt copy correctly, or that the cd isnt properly burnt?
no idea without working out why that script is failing
